cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSE of Port Arthur, Texas / Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest, then turning north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts before moving inland Thursday and up the Mississippi Valley thereafter
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border between Sea Rim State Park, TX and Johnson Bayou, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS and adjacent lakes (well east of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Freeport TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Tropical Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and eastward to Mouth of Mississippi
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Sea Rim State Park TX eastward across southwest Louisiana to the Mississippi River Delta—greatest impacts near the TX/LA border
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible, but sustained gale winds are unlikely (≤34-kt probability only 7%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (<3 ft) mainly as elevated tides and rough surf
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with isolated higher pockets; localized street/terminal flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and large swells may affect vessel operations and channel pilotage even though the storm core remains well east
